text: mainframes hosts 68% of world's
production it workload 90% of credit
card transactions still run on
mainframes gaining insights from this
massive data is crucial for businesses
to drive growth and Foster Innovation
however Mainframe data remains isolated
and not easily available to AI powered
analytics tools for extracting valuable
business insights additionally Mainframe
data is complex featuring unique data
types such as pack decimal comp 3 and
binary comp comp 4 which are not
natively supported by most analytics
tools this incompatibility poses a
significant challenge in leveraging the
wealth of information stored on
mainframes for datadriven
decisionmaking our solution empowers
Mainframe customers to unlock valuable
insights from their Mainframe data
within seconds by leveraging natural
language prompts in Amazon q and
quicksite and AWS Mainframe
modernization file transfer with BMC the
process involves three main steps the
first step is to securely transfer
Mainframe files and data sets to Amazon
S3 using AWS Mainframe modernization
file transfer with BMC assuring data
accessibility the second step is to
convert the Mainframe file types to a
format compatible with Amazon quick site
such as CSV enabling seamless
integration with the analytics platform
the final step is to generate business
insights and construct data stories
using the generative bi feature of
Amazon quick site Q powered by Amazon
Bedrock large language models llms this
Innovative feature allows you you to
extract valuable insights from your
Mainframe data through natural language
prompts directly this solution is
designed to benefit a wide range of
Industries including Financial Services
insurance and Automotive where critical
business data is stored in Mainframe
files or data sets the business use case
enables data analytics and insights on
that stored Mainframe data in this demo
we will showcase how our solution can
effectively address a critical business
challenge faced by a fortune 10
healthcare provider that offers medical
dental and vision plans to its members
across the United States the company
stores crucial member demographics and
plan information in Mainframe data sets
however extracting valuable insights
from this Mainframe data has been a
significant hurdle due to its siloed
nature and the complexity of integrating
it with modern analytics tools one of
the companies business analysts has been
tasked with analyzing the Mainframe data
and creating a visual dashboard to
present key metrics including one member
distribution by region two member
distribution by gender three member
distribution by age group four member
distribution by plan type five members
who have not completed preventive
immunizations Additionally the business
analyst needs to create a data story
that explains the insights derived from
the analysis and provides
recommendations to increase preventive
immunization rates among the company's
members traditionally accessing and
analyzing Mainframe data to fulfill such
requirements has been a daunting task
the siloed nature of the data and the
inability to integrated seamlessly with
modern analytics tools have hindered the
business analyst's ability to generate
valuable insights and present them in a
compelling manner through our solution
which combines the power of the AWS
Mainframe modernization file transfer
service and Amazon q and quick site we
will demonstrate how this healthc care
provider can overcome the business
challenge of extracting insights from
Mainframe data and unlock its full
potential for datadriven decision-
making to illustrate the power of our
solution we have prepared a sample data
set that represents the real world
scenario faced by the fortune 10
healthcare provider this data set
encompasses a comprehensive range of
member information including crucial
details that will enable us to derive
meaningful insights and address the
business analyst requirements the sample
data comprises the following attributes
member ID a unique identifier assigned
to each member member name the full name
of the member member type indicates
whether the member is an individual or
part of a family plan age the current
age of the member gender the member's
gender email the member's email address
for communication purposes region the
geographical region where the member
resides medical plan indicator indicates
whether the member has enrolled in a
medical Plan dental plan indicator
indicates whether the member has
enrolled in a dental plan Vision plan
indicator indicates whether the member
has enrolled in a vision plan preventive
immunization status indicates whether
the member has completed the recommended
preventive immunizations by leveraging
this comprehensive data set we will
demonstrate how our solution can
seamlessly migrate the Mainframe data to
Amazon S3 a highly scalable and secure
data Lake once the data is in S3 we will
harness the power of Amazon Q in quick
site to create interactive
visualizations and generate insightful
data
stories our solution combining the power
of the AWS Mainframe modernization file
transfer service and Amazon q and quick
site natural language generative bi
capabilities has effectively addressed
the first problem faced by the fortune
10 healthcare provider the business
analyst was tasked with creating a
visual dashboard to present key metrics
from the Mainframe data including member
distribution by region gender and age
group by migrating the Mainframe data
sets to Amazon S three using the AWS
Mainframe modernization file transfer
service we have unlocked The Silo data
and made it accessible for analysis and
visualization with the data residing in
S3 we leveraged generative bi
capabilities of Amazon Q in quick sight
and natural language prompts to generate
insightful visualizations in seconds
that provide a clear and concise
representation of the member
demographics the first visualization
created by simply prompting Amazon q and
quick site with show member distribution
by region offers a comprehensive view of
how members are distributed across
various geographical regions this
information is crucial for the healthc
care provider to understand Regional
Dynamics and tailor its services and
marketing strategies accordingly
ensuring optimal resource allocation and
targeted Outreach efforts the second
visualization generated with the prompt
show member distribution by gender
presents a breakdown of members based on
their gender this data can be
instrumental in identifying potential
gender specific health concerns and
developing targeted initiatives to
address the effectively ultimately
improving the overall quality of care
and member satisfaction the third
visualization created by prompting quick
site with show member distribution by
Age provides a detailed overview of the
age distribution among the healthcare
providers members this information is
invaluable for Designing age appropriate
health care plans identifying age
related Health Care needs and allocating
resources efficiently to cater to the
specific requirements of different age
groups by seamlessly integrating the
Mainframe data with Amazon q and quicks
sit's powerful VIs visualization and
natural language capabilities our
solution has enabled the business
analyst to create a comprehensive visual
dashboard in seconds that presents the
requested key metrics in an intuitive
and easy to understand format this
dashboard empowers the healthcare
provider with valuable insights into its
member demographics laying the
foundation for datadriven
decision-making and strategic
planning our solution combining the
power of the AWS Mainframe modernization
file transfer service and Amazon Q in
quicksite natural language generative bi
capabilities has effectively addressed
the second problem faced by the fortune
10 healthcare provider the business
analyst was tasked with creating a data
story that explains the insights derived
from the analysis and provides
recommendations to increase preventive
immunization rates among the company's
members utilizing the natural language
prompt build a data story about the
region with the most members also show
the member distribution by medical plan
Vision plan and dental plan recommend
how to motivate members to complete
immunization include Four Points of
supporting data our solution has
generated a comprehensive data story
that begins with an engaging
introduction setting the context and
clearly outlining the key objectives the
data story then proceeds to present an
in-depth analysis of the data seamlessly
integrating concise textual descriptions
with visually appealing and insightful
visualizations the analysis section
identifies the region with the highest
concentration of members and
meticulously examines the distribution
of members across various medical vision
and dental plans furthermore our
solution has enabled the data story
toing provide invaluable recommendations
on how the healthc care provider can
effectively motivate its members to
complete essential preventive
immunizations these recommendations are
reinforced by four robust data points
lending credibility and weight to the
proposed strategies the data story
concludes with a compelling call to
action urging the healthc care provider
to implement the recommended initiatives
and Leverage The insights to drive
improved member engagement and overall
healthc care outcomes through our
Solutions visually stunning and
information-rich visualizations coupled
with the seamlessly integrated data
Story the healthcare provider can
effectively communicate insights to
stakeholders facilitate datadriven
decision-making and ultimately enhance
the quality of care and services
provided to its valued
members now let's dive into the working
demo of our solution as mentioned
earlier our solution consists of three
key steps the first step in our solution
is to securely transfer Mainframe files
and data sets to Amazon S3 using the AWS
Mainframe modernization file transfer
service with BMC this step ensures data
access accessibility by seamlessly
migrating Mainframe data to the cloud
enabling further analysis and insights
generation while containing the sample
data for our demo our goal is to
transfer this file to Amazon S3 so that
the data can be used to generate
insights and data story using Amazon q
and quick site before we proceed to the
AWS console to initiate the transfer
it's crucial to verify that the
Mainframe file transfer agent is
installed and running in my case I've
confirmed that the Mainframe file
transfer agent CDP agent one is up and
running on the Mainframe now let's
access the AWS Mainframe modernization
file transfer service on the navigation
bar choose Services migration and
transfer and then choose AWS Mainframe
modernization on the left hand side
you'll see the file transfer data
transfer endpoint section click on data
transfer endpoint which lists all the
preconfigured endpoints in my case the
endpoint name is aws-1 Plex and it shows
as available if you need to create a new
data transfer endpoint on the top right
corner choose create data transfer
endpoint and follow the instructions to
view the configuration details for the
AWS 1px endpoint click on endpoint name
here you can verify that the main frame
agent CDP agent one is connected by
checking the last heartbeat time which
should be less than 2 minutes ago next
I'm going to create a transfer task to
move my Mainframe data set to Amazon S3
on the leftand menu choose transfer task
and then choose create transfer task for
the transfer task name enter demo task
and in the description box enter a
description about the task for the
Mainframe credentials choose the secret
key that stores the encrypted Mainframe
username and password in the S3
destination section choose the S3 bucket
where you want the file to be
transferred and then choose next for the
Mainframe data set field enter the
Mainframe data set name or perform a
wild card search if needed then click on
view data sets it will take a few
seconds to scan and search for the data
set from the Mainframe and the data sets
will be listed under Mainframe data sets
select the data set and click on ADD
data set will appear in added data set
section for source code Page Field
choose IBM 1047 for the Target code Page
Field choose utf8 which will convert
your ebcc data into ASI choose next and
then choose create transfer task to
initiate the transfer process it may
take some time for the task to complete
and you can monitor its progress in the
console once the task is complete its
status will change from running to
complete it select the completed task
which will display the transferred data
set its status and the Destin bucket to
access the transferred file directly
choose the bucket URL moving on to the
second step let's convert this file into
a CSV format so that the data can be
consumed in Amazon quick site I've set
up an AWS Lambda trigger from the target
bucket which will automatically convert
the file into a CSV file and store it in
the final bucket once the Lambda
function executes navigate to the final
Target bucket and you'll find the CSV
file created and stored successfully
now for the third and final step we'll
generate business insights and construct
data stories using the generative bi
feature of Amazon q and quick site
powered by Amazon bedrocks large
language models llms this Innovative
feature allows you to extract valuable
insights from your Mainframe data
through natural language prompts
directly within quick site once the
Mainframe data is successfully
transferred to the Amazon S3 bucket in
CSV format we can ingest this data into
Amazon quick site for data analysis and
insights generation
demo I have created an Amazon Q topic
Mainframe file transfer on the Mainframe
data to Leverage The generative bi
capability of Amazon quick site
Q now we will use natural language
prompts to derive insights from the data
the first prompt I will enter is show
member distribution by region Amazon
quick site Q has created a donut chart
visualizing the member distribution
across four
regions next let's explore the member
distribution by gender enter the prompt
show member distribution by gender
Amazon quicksite Q has quickly generated
a horizontal bar chart showcasing the
member distribution by gender to change
the visualization format on the top menu
choose visual type and then choose donut
chart moving forward we will enter the
prompt display member distribution by
medical plan Vision plan and dental plan
Amazon q and quick site has swiftly
created the requested visual within
seconds for the last visual we want to
identify members and their email IDs who
have not completed preventive
immunization enabling us to send
reminders effectively enter the prompt
Show members and their email IDs who
have not completed preventive
immunization now let's explore how to
create a data Story by entering a data
story description in natural language on
the leftand menu choose data stories and
then choose new story in the text box
enter the following prompt build a data
story about the region with the most
members also show the member
distribution by medical plan Vision plan
and dental plan recommend how to
motivate members to complete
immunization include Four Points of
supporting data after entering the
prompt we will add visuals to support
the story select the member distribution
by region member distribution by gender
member distribution by age and member
distribution by plan type visuals and
then choose the ad button with the
visuals added to the data story choose
the build button to generate the data
story within seconds Amazon quicksite Q
has created a rich and comprehensive
data Story the data story includes a
title an introduction the visuals you
added alongside text-based descriptions
and Analysis recommendations a call to
action and a conclusion through this
demonstration you can witness the power
of our solution in unlocking valuable
insights from Mainframe data enabling
datadriven decision-making and driving
business success this solution empowers
business users to derive actionable
insights from complex data sources
effortlessly fostering informed
decision-making and driving
organizational
growth refer to AWS prescriptive
guidance APG pattern generate Data
Insights by using AWS Mainframe
modernization and Amazon Q in quicksite
to build this
solution I hope this demonstration has
provided you with a clear understanding
of how to leverage AWS Mainframe
modernization file transfer with BMC and
Amazon Q in quick site to modernize your
Mainframe data and unlock its true
potential thank you for joining this
demo session feel free to reach out to
us for any questions or provide feedback
